      • getDocumentMetadata

        public static javax.ws.rs.core.Response getDocumentMetadata(java.lang.Object objKeyword)
                                                     throws org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONException
        The method GetDocumentMetadata is used to request the document id´s of the given project id, company id, employee id or document class
        Parameters:
        objKeyword - The given keywords from the speech client
        Returns:
        A Response-Object with all document id´s found for a given lookup key
        Throws:
        org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONException - throws a exception, if the json object could not be parsed

      • getWordinformation

        public static javax.ws.rs.core.Response getWordinformation(java.lang.Object objKeyword)
                                                    throws org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONException,
                                                           com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
        The method getWordinformation is used by the speech client to request further informations about a keyword
        Parameters:
        objKeyword - A JSON-Object with the keywords.
        Returns:
        Keyword informations like the associated project id, employee id or company id
        Throws:
        org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONException - throws a exception, if the json object could not be parsed
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - Intermediate base class for all problems encountered when processing (parsing, generating) JSON content that are not pure I/O problems

        Returns:

        Throws:
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - Intermediate base class for all problems encountered when processing (parsing, generating) JSON content that are not pure I/O problems

      • addDocumentMetadata

        public static void addDocumentMetadata(java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String driveID,
                                       java.lang.String status,
                                       java.lang.String keywords,
                                       java.lang.String drivePath,
                                       java.lang.String version,
                                       java.lang.String creationDate,
                                       java.lang.String createdBy,
                                       java.lang.String project,
                                       java.lang.String type,
                                       java.lang.String documentClass)
        AddDocumentMetadata This Method is responsible for adding the document metadata to the abox. The document metadata will be send by the google apps script client.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the document
        driveID - The google drive id of the document
        status - The actual status of the document
        drivePath - The drivePath of the document
        version - The version of the document
        creationDate - The creationdate of the document in a ISO 8601 format
        createdBy - The creater name of the document
        project - The associated project
        documentClass - The document class (e.g. Costplan)
        keywords - The associated keywords of the document
        type - The associated documenttype

      • editDocumentMetadata

        public static void editDocumentMetadata(java.lang.String driveID,
                                        java.lang.String oldName,
                                        java.lang.String newName,
                                        java.lang.String oldStatus,
                                        java.lang.String newStatus)
        The method EditDocumentMetadata is used by the apps script client to edit document metadata
        Parameters:
        driveID - The driveDocumentID.
        oldName - The old name of the document
        newName - The new given name of the document
        oldStatus - The old status of the document
        newStatus - The new given status of the document
